main event: A bright, egg-shaped object was sighted by an amateur astronomer over Fort Worth, Texas on April 29, 1962.
interesting points: The object appeared as a bright star and made three separate appearances over a 38-minute period, with the first sighting lasting 30 seconds, the second sighting lasting about 4 minutes, and the third sighting lasting 10 minutes.
The object exhibited unusual movement, including a rapid ascent and gradual descent, as well as splitting into three targets and then back into one before disappearing.
The sighting was confirmed by radar at the Duncanville, Texas GCI site and the Carswell AFB, which reported painting an unidentified target that split into three and then disappeared.
The observer, a 45-year-old nuclear engineer, and his two sons are experienced amateur astronomers and confirmed that the object's behavior was not consistent with known astronomical phenomena.
The observer provided several photographs and a full reel of 16mm movie footage of the object, which are currently being developed.
photographs: yes, several photographs and 16mm movie footage
